group_1.textRight: Here's what you've been waitin' for!@Almond jelly!
Still, eleven servings all of a sudden,@what's goin' on?
It really put your old man in a rush, Tsuruno.

group_1.textLeft: Weeeell, all sorts of reasons.@Anyway, thanks, Felicia!

group_1.textRight: [chara:401401:effect_emotion_joy_0][se:7222_happy]...It's here, it's here!@Mmm～, sweet and tasty.

group_1.textLeft: Thanks!
...But, y'know, we're planning to
remove this almond jelly from the menu@any day now.

group_1.textRight: [chara:401401:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]What, how come?!@But it's so good!

group_1.textLeft: Weeeell,@honestly, our almond jelly's not popular at all.

group_1.textRight: Is that true?
Now that you mention it,@I haven't seen that many people order it.

group_1.textLeft: I can't believe it...!@But don't you think it's tasty?

group_1.textRight: It's not that it isn't delicious.

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, but it doesn't feel tasty enough@to leave people craving it again.

group_1.textRight: I've never really heard of bad-tasting almond jelly.
...To cut a long story short, it's too normal?

group_1.textLeft: Just an average fifty-point almond jelly, I suppose.
Ugh... I think that's pretty much it.
I've tried all sorts of ideas, but...
It just never got the flavor that'd make someone say,@"This is it!"

group_1.textRight: It could be that its richness is a little too much
after very oily Chinese food.
Ah, I see what you're saying.

group_1.textLeft: Oh? It's a little heavy?

group_1.textRight: I'd say that's a good place to start changing it from!
It doesn't fit after a meal, right?
So if you make improvements from there,@it might become a popular menu item!

group_1.textLeft: It's too heavy...@Then, maybe I could switch to a milder syrup?

group_1.textRight: That idea's too dull!

group_1.textLeft: True,@"we made it milder" isn't a good sales pitch.

group_1.textRight: Having said that, wouldn't adding in too many@random things make it even heavier...?

group_1.textLeft: Its price would probably increase, as well.
It's already unpopular! A higher price would kill it!

group_1.textRight: Reducing the heaviness without raising the price...
That's trickyー
What do you think, Kazumi? Got any ideas?

group_1.textLeft: Hmm... What to do...

group_1.textRight: Ideas aren't coming quick, huh.
After all, your forte's Italian food, Kazumi.

group_1.textLeft: Italian... That's it!
What is it?

group_1.textRight: How about making it only half almond jelly,@and using fruit jelly to make up for the rest?
In layers, like tiramisu.

group_1.textLeft: As a test, I made some with the grape jelly we had@in the fridge, but...

group_1.textRight: [chara:100901:effect_emotion_surprise_0][se:7226_shock]Aaah?!

group_1.textLeft: Ohh?! What sort of reaction is that?

group_1.textRight: [chara:100901:effect_emotion_joy_0][se:7222_happy]What did you do? It's so delicious!
Yeah... It really surprised me.
It's the same almond jelly as before, but with a@refreshing melt-in-your-mouth feeling.
It's addicting.

group_1.textLeft: And it looks trendy, so it'll be the bees' knees@with vivacious girls♪

group_1.textRight: What era is that phrase from?!
The cost won't change much, since the amount@of almond jelly is reduced.
More pleasing to customers at the same price.@Very good idea.
This'll become a popular menu item for sure!
Whoa, it's got the Manaka seal of approval?!

group_1.textLeft: Thank goodness～!
Well, everyone kept saying "fifty points" this,@"fifty points" that.
So much that it kinda hurt my confidence.

group_1.textRight: So that's why you put Manaka in charge this time.

group_1.textLeft: Yeah, but next time,
I'll try my hardest, so I can confidently put@Banbanzai's cooking out there!
Thanks, Kazumi!

group_1.textRight: You're welcome!

group_1.textCenter: I've got friends in this town, too...@I'm glad I came to Kamihama!
